yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator

Functions

check_if_nearby

Check if a randomly generated point is close to the points already generated.

Create the standard 18 node network found in the Ridley 2017 research paper.

Create a mesh node environment.

Create a two group network.

Create a ring network.

Create a star node environment.

Create custom network through user interaction.

Creates the same network used to generated DCBO data.

Generate a random position for each node and saves it as a dictionary.

gnp_random_connected_graph

Create a randomly connected graph but with the guarntee that each node will have at least one connection.

load_network

Load a saved network so that it can be used by the generic network environment.

save_network

Save a network in a text file so that it can be used multiple times.
yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator.check_if_nearby(pos: List[float], full_list: dict, value: int) → bool[source]

Check if a randomly generated point is close to the points already generated.

yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator.generate_node_positions(adj_matrix: array) → dict[source]

Generate a random position for each node and saves it as a dictionary.

Parameters

adj_matrix – The adjacency matrix for the network

Returns

A dictionary of node positions

yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator.save_network(network_name: str, adj_matrix: array, positions: dict)[source]

Save a network in a text file so that it can be used multiple times.

Parameters

  • network_name – The name of the network

  • adj_matrix – The adjacency matrix for the network

  • positions – A dictionary of node positions

yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator.load_network(network_name: str) → Tuple[array, dict][source]

Load a saved network so that it can be used by the generic network environment.

Parameters

network_name – The name of the network

Returns

The adjacency matrix A position dictionary for all the nodes

yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator.create_18_node_network() → Tuple[array, dict][source]

Create the standard 18 node network found in the Ridley 2017 research paper.

Returns

The adjacency matrix that represents the network A dictionary of positions of the nodes

yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator.dcbo_base_network() → Tuple[array, dict][source]

Creates the same network used to generated DCBO data.

Returns

The adjacency matrix that represents the network and a dictionary of positions of the nodes.

New in version 1.0.1.

yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator.create_mesh(size: int = 100, connectivity: float = 0.7) → Tuple[array, dict][source]

Create a mesh node environment.

Parameters

  • size – the number of nodes in the environment

  • connectivity – how connected each of the nodes should be (percentage chance for any node to be connected to

  • other) (any) –

Returns

The adjacency matrix that represents the network A dictionary of positions of the nodes

yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator.create_star(first_layer_size: int = 8, group_size: int = 5, group_connectivity: float = 0.5) → Tuple[array, dict][source]

Create a star node environment.

This is one node in the middle with groups of nodes around it. There is only one connection between a group and the center node. Groups cannot connect to each other.

Parameters

  • first_layer_size – the number of collections of nodes in first “outer ring”

  • group_size – how many nodes are in each collection

  • group_connectivity – how connected the nodes in the connections are

Returns

The adjacency matrix that represents the network A dictionary of positions of the nodes

yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator.create_p2p(group_size: int = 5, inter_group_connectivity: float = 0.1, group_connectivity: int = 1) → Tuple[array, dict][source]

Create a two group network.

You can modify the connectivity between the two groups and the connectivity within the groups.

Parameters

  • group_size – the amount of nodes in each group (before random variance)

  • inter_group_connectivity – the connectivity between the two groups

  • group_connectivity – the connectivity within the group

Returns

The adjacency matrix that represents the network A dictionary of positions of the nodes

yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator.create_ring(break_probability: float = 0.3, ring_size: int = 60) → Tuple[array, dict][source]

Create a ring network.

Parameters

  • break_probability – the probability that two nodes will not be connected

  • ring_size – the number of nodes in the network

Returns

The adjacency matrix that represents the network A dictionary of positions of the nodes

yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator.custom_network() → Union[Tuple[array, dict], Tuple[None, None]][source]

Create custom network through user interaction.

Returns

The adjacency matrix that represents the network and A dictionary of positions of the nodes. If the size input is not a valid int, None, None is returned.

yawning_titan.envs.generic.helpers.network_creator.gnp_random_connected_graph(n_nodes: int, probability_of_edge: float) → Optional[Tuple[array, dict]][source]

Create a randomly connected graph but with the guarntee that each node will have at least one connection.

This is taken from the following stack overflow Q&A with a bit of a refactor for clarity

Parameters

  • n_nodes – the number of nodes in the graph

  • probability_of_edge – the probability for a node to have an edge

Returns

The adjacency matrix that represents the network A dictionary of positions of the nodes
